ai.summary: Amber Valley Routeway Walk 17 is a roughly 9.7 km moderate hike in the UK that traverses varied countryside along the Amber Valley route. The route features a mix of open fields, shaded woodland, and gentle elevation changes, making for a steady pace suitable for walkers with some experience and good footwear.
ai.terrain_summary: Terrain includes gravel tracks, grassy fields, and occasional muddy sections. Paths are generally well-defined with some gentle ascents and a few stepped areas. Footing can be uneven after rain; waterproof boots and sturdy footwear are recommended. Expect exposure in open sections and occasional shaded, uneven terrain in wooded areas.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather and daylight hours before you go. Stay on marked paths and carry a map or GPS. Let someone know your route and expected finish time. Bring plenty of water and snacks, plus layers and a waterproof jacket. Be mindful of livestock and gate closures, and watch for slippery sections after rain. Mobile signal can be limited in rural parts of the UK.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
Phone with offline map and emergency contacts
First aid kit (blister care, basic supplies)
Headlamp or flashlight (for late finishes or low light)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (with caution and proper gear during winter)
